Title: Whisky, Craft, and Collaboration: An Exclusive Tour of Glenfiddich’s Dufftown Distillery
Summary: The Valley of the Deer holds centuries of secrets and amber streams whisper tales of craftsmanship . A carefully curated group of Nigeria’s visionary entrepreneurs and whisky enthusiasts were welcomed .

Title: Katsina govt blames communities, informants for 80% of insecurity
Summary: Kastina govt blames communities, informants for 80% of insecurity . The Commissioner, Internal Security and Home Affairs, Nasir Muazu, made the remarks .

Title: VC, medical experts task nurses on overcoming rigorous working conditions
Summary: Vice-Chancellor of Redeemer’s University, Prof. Shadrach Akindele, and some medical experts urge nurses to demonstrate compassion to patients . This charge was given on Thursday as a result of the charge .

Title: CPPE backs Tinubu’s Customs CG tenure extension
Summary: Centre for the Promotion of Private Enterprise (CPPE) has praised President Bola Tinubu’s decision to extend the tenure of the Comptroller General of the Nigeria Customs Service (NCS), Bashir Adeniyi . CPPE recognises his reforms in trade efficiency, transparency, and technological enhancements .

Title: Reps panel orders DSS, Army to grant access to terror suspect, Danladi
Summary: Reps panel orders DSS, Army to grant access to family members and counsel to terror suspect, Mr. Ntari Hassan Danladi . The House of Representatives committee on Public Petition has directed the authorities of the Department of State Services (DSS) and the Nigeria Army .

Title: New border facilities will enhance national security – FG
Summary: The Federal Government has assured that the newly deployed border management system of the Nigeria Immigration Service NIS is enhancing target-based profiling, through the interactive advanced passenger information API and Passenger Name Record PNR technology .

Title: Hulk Hogan’s cause of death confirmed after wrestler’s passing
Summary: Wrestling legend Hulk Hogan died at 71 from a heart attack, officially listed as acute myocardial infarction, according to the New York Post . Wrestling legend's cause of death confirmed after wrestler’s passing .

Title: We are not against Dangote Refinery, say oil marketers
Summary: We are not against Dangote Refinery, say oil marketers . Their focus remains on ensuring Nigerians have access to high-quality petroleum products at affordable prices .

Title: Sanwo-Olu, Obasa mourn ex-Lagos lawmaker, Victor Akande
Summary: Lagos State Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu and Speaker of the State House of Assembly, Mudashiru Obasa, have expressed grief over the death of former lawmaker Hon. Victor Akande . The former lawmaker passed away on Wednesday .

Title: BBNaija S10: Mensan breaks down in tears, shares family struggles
Summary: Mensan is the latest Big Brother Naija contestant to shed tears during a diary session with Biggie . The emotional highs and lows of the reality TV reality show continue . Mensan shares family struggles during diary session .

Title: Only Kebbi offers 100% free education nationwide – Idris
Summary: Governor of Kebbi State, Nasir Idris, has said only his state in Nigeria provides free education and scholarships to students studying within and outside the country . Idris disclosed this during a courtesy visit by the Senior Special Assistant to the President on Students’ Matters, Mr Sunday Dare, in Government House, Birnin Keb

Title: MMA star McGregor loses appeal in rape civil case
Summary: Mixed martial arts fighter Conor McGregor loses appeal in Ireland over a civil court ruling last year awarding damages to a woman who accused him of rape . Three judges at the Court of Appeal in Dublin dismissed all the grounds for appeal raised by McGregor . McGregor was awarded damages of almost 250,000 euros ($258,000) to Nikita Hand,

Title: Kaduna pensioners demand N62,000 minimum pension implementation
Summary: The Nigeria Union of Pensioners, Kaduna State chapter, Alhassan Musa, has called on the state government to implement the new minimum pension of N62,000 approved by the Federal Government . Musa also urged the government to address the lingering issues concerning contributory pensioners, especially at the local government level .

Title: Bianca Ojukwu meets Ghanaian officials over 'Nigerians must go' protest
Summary: The Minister of State for Foreign Affairs, Ambassador Bianca Odumegwu-Ojukwu has appealed for calm following calls by some Ghanaians for the deportation of Nigerians from the country . She spoke during a joint press conference with Ghana’s Foreign Affairs Minister, Samuel Ablakwa, in Accra on Wednesday

Title: ‎Terrorism, banditry, climate change key conflict drivers - ‎IPCR report
Summary: The Institute for Peace and Conflict Resolution officially launched the 2024 edition of its Strategic Conflict Assessment . The 859-page document offers a detailed state-by-state analysis of conflict trends, actors, and structural drivers across the country’s 36 states and the Federal Capital Territory . It also presented policy recommendations aimed at achieving sustainable peace .
